title: US to address killing of American citizen ‘directly’ with Israel
description: Palestinian rights advocates call for US sanctions on Israeli unit involved in killing of 80-year-old Omar Assad.

title: Bud Light loses out on featuring transgender influencer Mulvaney
description: The media promotion by the beer maker led to a backlash of transphobic comments and a boycott by some drinkers.

title: Ukraine attacks the front line; Russia says big losses inflicted
description: Ukraine says its forces recaptured 100sq km, but Russia's President Putin says counteroffensive attacks failed.

title: Thousands protest against strict abortion law in Poland
description: Women's rights advocates called for protests in dozens of Polish cities after a five-month pregnant woman died of sepsis

title: US Southern Baptists reject two churches over women pastors
description: The denomination's annual convention affirms stance maintaining the role of pastor is exclusively for men.

title: Could governments stifle innovation if they regulate AI?
description: The European Parliament passes draft law to check threats posed by artificial intelligence.

title: Guatemalan court convicts prominent journalist José Rubén Zamora
description: Critics have denounced the case against investigative journalist Jose Ruben Zamora as an attack on press freedom.

title: US Fed holds interest rates steady, indicates hikes upcoming
description: Holding rates steady will allow Fed to assess information as it seeks to balance risk to economy and high inflation.

title: Eight presidential candidates enter Ecuador’s early election race
description: Facing impeachment, Ecuador's president made the extraordinary move of dissolving legislature, calling early elections.

title: Eight Kenyan police killed in suspected al-Shabab bombing
description: The incident took place on Tuesday in Garissa county in eastern Kenya, a region on the border with Somalia.

title: Sudan’s raging war forces more than two million from their homes
description: The fighting has displaced more than 1.6 million people inside Sudan, with another 530,000 fleeing to other countries.

title: Clooney Foundation sues Venezuela for alleged rights abuses
description: Lawsuit calls on Argentina to apply principle of 'universal jurisdiction' to prosecute alleged abuses in Venezuela.

title: Pakistan villagers fear what Cyclone Biparjoy will take away
description: Tens of thousands of people have been displaced as the country braces for a cyclone to make landfall on Thursday.

title: US, Iranian officials held talks in Oman in May: Media reports
description: Omanis shuttled between two delegations, which did not meet, Axios reports.

title: Waiving US visas for Israelis would be a mistake
description: The US should not give up protecting its own citizens just to present another political gift to the Israeli government.

title: China’s Xi Jinping backs ‘just cause’ of Palestinian statehood
description: China believes in an 'independent Palestinian state based on 1967 borders with East Jerusalem as its capital', Xi says.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan defies pressure over Sweden’s NATO application
description: Turkish president says the Nordic nation has not fully addressed his security concerns.

title: US confirms top diplomat Blinken’s long-anticipated China visit
description: Trip had been delayed amid 'spy balloon' incident that underscored rising tensions between the superpowers.

title: Ugandan anti-LGBTQ law deepens Anglican Church rift on gay rights
description: The latest split in the Anglican Church comes after recent comments by the Archbishop of Canterbury on Uganda's new law.

title: Nigeria allows currency to drop third of value on official market
description: For decades, multiple exchange rates had led to foreign currency shortages that worsened under Godwin Emefiele.

title: How I rescue people caught in Sudan’s war | Close Up
description: As the war tears families apart, a young man transforms Port Sudan into a safe haven for those fleeing the fighting.

title: Derailed: Investigating the US railroad industry
description: After a train derailment in Ohio, Fault Lines investigates if the railroad industry has prioritised profits over safety.

title: The family behind a unique Palestinian football club
description: A tiny village football club fight their way from the bottom to become Palestinian Premier League champions.

title: Bosnia arrests 13-year-old after school shooting wounds teacher
description: The incident comes after two mass shootings in neighbouring Serbia showed the normalisation of violence in the Balkans.

title: A year in jail for Indian activist held over Prophet remarks row
description: Javed Mohammad is accused of instigating demonstrations but his family and lawyers say there is no evidence against him.

title: EC migration deal ignores Tunisia’s repression: Rights groups
description: Rights groups are concerned the EC deal, in following its anti-migrant agenda, props up Tunisia's authoritarianism.

title: HRW accuses M23 militia of rape, finds mass graves in DR Congo
description: The group says that M23's killings and rapes in eastern DRC are bolstered by the military support of Rwandan officials.

title: The genius behind Zambia’s first anime series
description: Getting an animation series to audiences in Zambia takes talent, patience and persistence.

title: Australian senator accuses male colleague of sexual assault
description: Thorpe alleged conservative senator Van 'harassed' and 'sexually assaulted' her - before withdrawing the comments.

title: Russia jails Navalny campaigner Lilia Chanysheva for ‘extremism’
description: The former campaign chief in Ufa sentenced to seven and a half years in prison for 'creating an extremist organisation'.

title: Italians bid farewell to ex-PM and media tycoon Silvio Berlusconi
description: Thousands gather in Milan for funeral of controversial politician and TV mogul who dominated public life for decades.

title: Lebanon’s parliament fails to elect president for 12th time
description: Quorum was broken after the bloc led by Hezbollah withdrew following the first round vote.

title: Taiwan’s FM seeks ‘support from European friends’ in Prague
description: Taiwan's top diplomat Joseph Wu holds meetings in Prague to improve relations with the EU, angering China.

title: Biden celebrates Juneteenth with concert at White House
description: In 2021, Biden signed legislation establishing the federal holiday to commemorate the end of slavery in the US.

title: Egypt approves budget amid privatisation drive, economic crisis
description: The budget comes amid an economic crisis, with the government seeking investments to meet its foreign debt obligations.

title: AI helped create new Beatles song using Lennon’s voice: McCartney
description: McCartney said technology was used to 'extricate' Lennon’s voice from an old demo which was used to complete the song.
